result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan A. Caruso was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid during period of Extended Supervision in 13-CF-714.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megan A. Caruso

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes sentence of 1 year jail concurrent to 13CF714 and 14CF218; credit for 167 days served; costs ordered, deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge, to be paid during period of extended supervision in 13CF714.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 9/10/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Komp and ADA McNeill the FPT of 5/7/15 at 8:45am is rescheduled; as the deft is in outpatient treatment and will be done in 9 weeks; reset to 7/28/15 at 8:30am.
